Edward LeCompte

Edward LeCompte is running for Red Bank City Commission, 3rd District
Back to races

More info

Why do you want to run for public office?

I want to assist and serve my Red Bank Friends and Neighbors in improving our economic development.

I want a thriving, vibrant and well-maintained niche community of families, friends and neighbors.

Please identify three issues that are important to you as a candidate.

1. Economic and community development
new business
new infrastructure
support schools

2. Adopt Zoning Ordinances to protect our home and business property values

3. Proper and Complete Funding for all our city departments including admin, fire, police and public works

If elected, how would you address those issues?

Open door policy
Town Hall Meetings
Revise city codes, update the city charter, adopt the zoning ordinances, support the employees and all departments.
actively pursue new business development in Red Bank
Appoint and Hire a Business Development Recruiter
Appoint and Hire a Special Event - Community Director to benefit Citizens and Visitor Tourism

About this guide

There are more than 60 candidates in Hamilton County's Nov. 4 election. Over the past few weeks, Nooga.com sent the candidates brief surveys to help voters get a better understanding of the people who want to represent them in federal, state and local governments. Our guide also features easy-to-read breakdowns of the amendments and ballot measures you'll see on election day.
